results.title: The Voice of Ivan Frost
results.creator_credit: Alanya Van De Wiel, Ann Shenfield, Paul Fletcher, Robert Stephenson and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: In a surreal industrial landscape populated by equally bizarre characters, the magical voice of celebrated singer Ivan Frost has the power to make people wish for death. In a remote village elsewhere, Alfonso Pellegrini, a shepherd with an astonishing musical talent, longs to leave his sheep and go in search of the fabulous sounds described in books. Being invited to play beside the remarkable singer, Alfonso is saddened to find himself thrust into the background, his precious violin broken from trying to compete for attention. Ivan’s world is similarly turned upside down when he awakens to find his voice gone and a scar across his chest. Without his legendary voice to bewitch the masses and open doors for him, he is forced to confront the nightmarish reality of his situation - alone.

results.title: The Vital signs and their inter-relation: body temperature, pulse, respiration, blood pressure
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids and Willard Pictures
results.brief_description:
A study of the physiology of the respiratory, heat regulatory, and circulatory systems, and their inter-relation in normal functioning, as well as in deviations from the normal. How to ascertain and record the vital signs, the importance of making thorough and accurate observations, and how to take care of the apparatus necessary for these observations, is demonstrated.
Designed for use in the instruction of professional nurses.

results.title: The Visit
results.creator_credit: Jack Gold, John Hall and BFI
results.brief_description: A searching study of suburban futility. Shows in painstaking and intricate detail the chilling, deadening aimlessness of an unmarried woman’s existence - an existence divided between the exhausting monotony of machine-minding and the nervous strain of caring for her stolid, vacant, fractious parents. The routine is broken by a relative’s telephone call wanting to pay a visit and introduce his fiancee. For Alice the natural behaviour of the young couple is a revelation, bringing home to her, her own desperate situation and the implacable passage of time. Cast includes: Alice Spaul, Eunice Phelps, George Wood.

results.title: The Visit
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin, Julian Biggs and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Paul, a young French Canadian, is caught between two ways of life, and must choose for himself between the old and the new. After a two year absence, Paul returns to the Quebec village where he grew up. His father hopes he will stay and take over his boat-building trade. Despite family ties, Paul sees the inevitable change that is coming to the province and responds to the stronger call of the industrial world.

results.title: The Villagers
results.creator_credit: Bernice Nassauer, Derrick Knight, Peter Neal and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: In Senegal, youthful villagers are sent off to learn simple new things in a government course and then returned to their own towns to teach their skills to the rest of the people. In Indonesia, French agronomists teach the “Green Revolution” to the whole region and set up a co-op to purchase machinery and guarantee a market for rice. And in Peru, a Government begins a land reform program in spite of the suspicions of those whom it is designed to help.
